text: one of my favorite columns in our
magazine is called five ways and this
month it's five ways with penning and
one of our five ways is with pancetta
and tomatoes everything just gets
roasted in the oven together and then
tossed with the pasta at the end it
couldn't be easier or more delicious
to start off I'm just dropping 3/4 of a
pound of penne into some salted boiling
water give your pasta a stir and then
just let it cook according to package
directions I think that probably takes
about 12 minutes slice 1 large red onion
not only is this recipe really easy to
prepare it's also quite fast it should
take no more than 25 minutes start to
finish Finley place your red onion and
then put it on to a rimmed baking sheet
make sure it's even so everything cooks
evenly then add 2 pints of cherry
tomatoes 1/2 teaspoon of hot pepper
flakes if you want to use let's go right
ahead we're sensitive to spice not like
me a tablespoon of oil and then top with
4 ounces of pancetta pancetta is a cured
unsmoked pork product made from pork
belly kind of like bacon but not smoked
if you can't find it please feel free to
use bacon in its place it'll taste very
delicious too this goes into the oven at
450 degrees until the tomatoes are burst
and the pancetta is crisp and the fat
render takes about 20 minutes
those guys are cooking away I think my
pasta is almost done before you drain
your pasta make sure you reserve some
water about 1/4 cup I'm gonna go with
1/2 cup probably won't need it all give
it a drain shake off all the excess
liquid and then there's one more
ingredient some parsley to chop up
before we're ready to combine everything
that was fast right that was really fast
I have my parsley wrapped in a damp
towel to keep it fresh nice fresh
parsley to finish this off I won't
complain you know I like a fresh herb at
the end of almost everything I'm a fresh
herb fanatic and you should be one too
because they're good for you and they're
delicious and they add a lot of variety
and texture to your life times
mm oh my gosh I just want to put that on
a piece of bread scrape all your
deliciousness straight into the pasta
pot make sure you don't leave anything
behind because it's those last little
bits of juiciness on the pan that are
gonna really add the flavor I don't know
you could go so far as to use a rubber
spatula to make sure and then about a
quarter cup of the pasta water you can
turn the heat back on under the pasta
just for a sec to combine everything it
doesn't need too much pasta water that
just sort of helps everything come
together yummy this is gonna need fault
because I didn't salt it before but I
wanted to be careful because of the
pancetta which has salt in it so I'm
gonna season it a little bit a little
bit of parsley well a lot bit no cheese
in this one tear it free how about some
black pepper once you lock up I'm into
it
what about you shall I serve up the
plate I'm in love with it I'm completely
in love with it it's got pretty much
everything going for it I'm in love with
the speed the simplicity and the
deliciousness of this dish and you're
gonna be too if you try it so let me
know what you think please write in and
tell me I love hearing from you and
coming soon in our March issue of
everyday food for more great recipes
just like this
